name: 2sbbii
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, wff w0, wff w1
body: |- wb(wsb(s0, s1, wsb(s2, s3, w0)), wsb(s0, s1, wsb(s2, s3, w1)))

stmt.origin: sbbii(s0, s1, wsb(s2, s3, w0), wsb(s2, s3, w1))

body.origin:
|- wb(wsb(s0, s1, wsb(s2, s3, w0)), wsb(s0, s1, wsb(s2, s3, w1)))
-| wb(wsb(s2, s3, w0), wsb(s2, s3, w1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wsb(s0, s1, wsb(s2, s3, w0)), wsb(s0, s1, wsb(s2, s3, w1)))
-| wb(wsb(s2, s3, w0), wsb(s2, s3, w1))

body.origin:
|- wb(wsb(s2, s3, w0), wsb(s2, s3, w1))
-| wb(w0, w1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wsb(s0, s1, wsb(s2, s3, w0)), wsb(s0, s1, wsb(s2, s3, w1)))
-| wb(w0, w1)

comment: Infer double substitution into both sides of a logical equivalence. (Contributed by AV, 30-Jul-2023.)
